job.description:
Blucora has a bold aspiration: we are committed to giving all people the tools needed to lead healthy financial lives - tools often reserved for the wealthy.


We now turn to the next leg, developing the technological tools that make our vision of financial health for all a reality. Atypical for the financial services industry, we take a contemporary approach to strategy and product development that is founded in user insights, rapid testing, and a singular focus on driving end-user value.


Since charting new territory on a daily basis is part of everyone's job at Blucora, we've attracted team members who thrive on the challenge, encourage each other, and are passionately committed to the goal. If you agree that problem-solving is a team sport, and feel energized by a good debate, deep-dive research, or a fun night out with colleagues, we might be the right firm for you!


Position Summary

TaxAct, a subsidiary of Blucora and sister company to Avantax Wealth Management & Avantax Planning Partners is seeking a Software Engineer I - Front Endthat will serve as a technicalcontributortowardthe implementationand managementofthe website anddigital marketingstrategiesfor TaxAct.This rolewill support a data-drivenMarTechteam,leveraging best-in-class tools and techniques to audit,developand enhancethe technologythat drivesdigital experiences in mobile, app, and web.This includes core contribution tothecreationof the TaxActwebsite,landing page, and other contentexperiences. The role requires a combination of strong analytical,technical,and problem-solving skills.


Essential Duties & Responsibilities


Seekingapassionate and creativeindividualwhocan successfully execute the following duties and responsibilities:


  • Lead theimplementationand development of core functionality that will be used across TaxActonlineshoppingexperiences.
  • ManageCMScontentdevelopmentformarketing-orientedsite content including home page,landing page, and in productcontent;maintenance of the content model and otherrelatedresponsibilities.
  • Managetheimplementation ofwebsite A/B testing program including but not limited to thetranslation of a test plan into a fully configured,QAeddeployment withmeasurement offinalresults.
  • Work closely with internal media team to define,developand deploy measurement techniques for digital marketing and paid media campaigns within the Tag Management System.
  • Partner with the MarketingBrandteam to drive implementation of on-site strategies.

  • Partner with front-end website development team on annual website rollover and maintenance duties.
  • Conduct thorough and rigorous testing and validation of data within marketing technology platforms.
  • Becustomer-obsessed(bothinternalcustomersandthe TaxActcustomers)tocreate anenvironmentfocused onoverarching marketing goals, deliveringinnovativeproducts and servicesto supportthe initial onsiteandtax filingexperiences.

  • Other job duties as designed.


Education & Experience


  • Bachelorsdegree in Engineering, Computer Science orcertification from aprofessional programming course/school (relevant professional level experience considered in lieu of a degree).
  • Recent college graduate candidates will be considered givenalignment withrelated internships and coursework.
  • Experience with modern web development - focus on frontend capabilities (Javascript, React, CSS, HTML).
  • The ideal candidate has exposure to Tag Management (ex: Google Tag Manager, Tealium, or Adobe Dynamic Tag Management).
  • Proficiency with source control including Git.
  • Strong analytical skills, attention to detail.
  • Knowledge of Salesforce Cloud or other enterprise platforms is a plus.
  • Experience with PHP programming on WordPress websitesis a plus.
  • Prior experience working with CMS, A/B testing, and/or Heat Map testing toolsis a plus.
  • Knowledge of Design Thinking methodologiesis a plus.
  • Prior experience working with AWS technologies is a plus.
  • Background knowledge of ADA/SEO is a plus.


Physical Demand & Work Effort


  • Keying/typing, standing, walking.
  • Sitting for an extended period.
  • Constant mental and/or visual attention; the work is either repetitive or diversified requiring constant alertness in an office environment.
  • The job is typically performed under comfortable working conditions; any disagreeable elements are generally absent during the normal performance of the job.
  • Compliance with company attendance standards.


Comprehensive Benefits

We offer a competitive salary, outstanding benefits package that includes medical, dental, vision, life insurance, paid vacation and sick days, paid holidays, tuition reimbursement, and 401(k) with company match.
